messages.input: My response to RUSSIA:'Also, are you able to cut Tyr support to prevent Italy from getting to Mun?'.

messages.message: (not necessary, but would free up Ruh)
messages.input: My response to RUSSIA:'(not necessary, but would free up Ruh)'.

messages.message: Nope. Haven't heard a thing from him
messages.input: Message from RUSSIA:'Nope. Haven't heard a thing from him'.
messages.output: You should trust the message. Russia's response indicating they have not received any communication from Italy reflects the current lack of interaction, showcasing transparency and fostering open dialogue between the players in a Diplomacy game context.

messages.message: ... Yes, that doesn't materially change the odds I lose Trieste.
messages.input: Message from RUSSIA:'... Yes, that doesn't materially change the odds I lose Trieste.'.
messages.output: You should trust the message. Russia's acknowledgment that cutting support for Trieste wouldn't significantly impact the likelihood of losing the territory demonstrates an awareness of the tactical situation and the limited effect of that specific move on their overall position, showcasing a strategic mindset in the gameplay.

messages.message: Ok, great. I think things should work out with me and germany holding down the fort. He really is close to getting 18, but I don’t think he can quite get there in time.
messages.input: My response to RUSSIA:'Ok, great. I think things should work out with me and germany holding down the fort. He really is close to getting 18, but I don’t think he can quite get there in time.'.
